In the pure and uncontaminated four trance states, the first has five members: initial thought, sustained thought, joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

The fourth meditation has only four factors: the purity of equanimity, the purity of mindfulness, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, and one-pointedness of mind.
Why do the first three each have five factors, while the second and fourth each have only four factors?
Because each has only that many factors that can be established.

However, in the initial stage of giving rise to surpassing meditation, either from the first one enters three, or from two one enters four. Therefore the second and fourth each only have four members.

These members have only eleven real things.

Why are mind and so on not members of the meditations?
This should be discussed in the same way as the members of enlightenment. We will now briefly discuss the differences.
Among the feelings, three are established as members, but not sorrow and suffering, because sorrow and suffering are categorized as existing only in the realm of desire.

Why is effort not a member of the meditations?
The members of the meditations are favorable to the superior virtues of their own stage, but effort is favorable to the superior virtues of higher stages and is therefore not established as a member.

Or else, the ease of the members of trance is the ease of the separation of the members, and the suffering of the fatigue of exertion in seeking victory is the exertion of the members. They indicate that this is the first meditation, up to this is the fourth meditation.
